comments.body: That tried that at first. I haven't thought about the logic to implement something like this but unfortunately jopts-simple implementation of this required logic is limited. TL;DR; using `requiredIf` didn't work because I think there is a cycle in the graph.

    .availableUnless("path-to-json-file")
    .withRequiredArg
    .describedAs("topic name")
    .ofType(classOf[String])

comments.body: As far as I can tell, this is not used. We assume it is provided if the `singleTopicPartition` match above hits the  default case, but I'm wondering what the behavior is if the user specifies only --topic. Seems that would be allowed because it does not depend on --partition?

Yeah. It is use by jopt-simple to validate the flags but assumes it based on the constraints:
```
$ bin/kafka-leader-election.sh --topic test --bootstrap-server localhost:9092 --election-type unclean
Exception in thread "main" joptsimple.MissingRequiredOptionsException: Missing required option(s) [partition]
        at joptsimple.OptionParser.ensureRequiredOptions(OptionParser.java:426)
        at joptsimple.OptionParser.parse(OptionParser.java:400)
        at kafka.admin.LeaderElectionCommandOptions.<init>(LeaderElectionCommand.scala:237)
        at kafka.admin.LeaderElectionCommand$.run(LeaderElectionCommand.scala:46)
        at kafka.admin.LeaderElectionCommand$.main(LeaderElectionCommand.scala:42)
        at kafka.admin.LeaderElectionCommand.main(LeaderElectionCommand.scala)
```

I added this comment: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/6686/files#diff-d1bfa28bb2fe6969e0923a468b81e666R66
The semantics we implement are really more like `all-eligible-partitions`. The name is fine, but might be worth emphasizing in the doc.
